title: Chelsea news: Thibaut Courtois gives strange reason for Blues dropping points at Turf Moor | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 4:24 pm It rained consistently during the game with periods of snow (Picture: Getty) 
Thibaut Courtois has insisted Burnley are an extremely difficult side to beat at home after Chelsea dropped points at Turf Moor. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
The Chelsea stopper was beaten by a wonderful Robbie Brady free-kick and Courtois believes the weather conditions played a part in the draw. 
Antonio Conte’s side went ahead after just seven minutes, but were pegged back by Brady’s superb effort. 
Chelsea are still ten points clear at the top of the table and Courtois admitted his side were happy with a point. 
‘Burnley away, with their home record they are a really difficult side to play away,’ he said. Chelsea fixtures 
Swansea (H) – Sat 25 Feb West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Watford (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr Robbie Brady curled in spectacular free-kick to level the game (Picture: Getty) 
‘The pitch was not good, there was snow, it was cold and not an ideal situation but we started very well. 
‘We scored and I think we conceded a free-kick where you could see the quality of Brady. 
‘After the goal we couldn’t find our game from the first 20 minutes. Antonio Conte will have been disappointed to have not built on a brilliant start (Picture: Getty)
